subject: oem-ibm: Resource dump support
commitMessage:
oem-ibm: Resource dump support

This commit includes the changes to support resource dump. Input
parameters to initiate resource dump are vsp string and the
password.

Resource Dump Flow:
1. PLDM waits for the resource dump create signal from
   dump manager
2. BMC sends the NewfileAvailable command to hypervisor with
   resource dump paramters
   Format: <Length of the VSP String><VSP String>
   <Length of the Password><Password>
3. Hypervisor reads and validates the data and send the File Ack
   command back to BMC
4. Once completed, BMC receives the NewfileAvailable command from
   hypervisor with resource dump details
5. User initiates the dump offload
6. BMC receives the  write file by type from memory command from
   hypervisor
7. Once this operation is completed BMC receives the File Ack
   command from hyperviosr

Tested By:
1. Initiating the resource dump using pldmtool, busctl and redfish
2. Verified that resource dump entry is updated with source id,
   length, completion time and status.
3. Dump offload is successful with initiating from redfish
4. Verified that new resource dump is generated at hypervisor level
5. Error scenarios tested are like empty vsp string, not supported
   vsp string etc.

Signed-off-by: Jayashankar Padath <jayashankar.padath@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Iedcdf3cf16c263a2d1749bb5251f7f6244c327ea

I do not understand why `return` and `break` appear at the same time in switch?
Could you refactor these code?
If so, Maybe you can use `if,else if, else`
Yes there is no need for return and break. I am not aware why we did like this. Removing breaks.

Excessive if conditions。
Could you refactor these?
Done.. Just keeping the dumpType related condition for any future dump type addtions.
Error handling for this failure is handled at the end in a single place along with the decode failure to avoid the code duplication.
Single place to update the error
Maybe you can wrap a lamda?
a brief point on the flow would be helpful
you can remove the trace. keep the error path traces
why you are creating the socket here? you can pass the socket and dbusImplReq from pldmd into the Handler of fileio. there are examples like bios.cpp
thi smay not be needed since you will get the host eid from pldmd
what is this usecase? only for sys dump?
This is needed both for system dump and resource dump. During the resource dump offload path if the multiple entries are present we need to identify the matching one and return.

why it is 1? do you expect this to be 1 later?
ideally the new file available function should have this as a param

Currently we are only getting vsp string and password from dump manager and source dump id is not set at this point. We can see if this needs a change when we add support of multiple resource dump scenario. I shall add a comment here.
should we return from here or continue?
you can go via filehandle and get that as a parameter in the function. may be can be done in multiple dump support
Okay I have already put a note on reconsidering it
pls add that this class can be used as a pldm requester in oem-ibm path

change to D-Bus.
object path of?

Hi Deepak,
i have created a story to tackle this. we will revisit this portion to implement your comment as part of that story in upcoming sprints

nit: About this method(switch case), I do not think it need to include return,maybe need to refactor it, @Sampa, what do you think?
But I am OK in this commit.
i guess i am ok with this commit

Remove the inner parentheses, Because == priority is higher than ||

else if (dumpType == PLDM_FILE_TYPE_RESOURCE_DUMP ||
         dumpType == PLDM_FILE_TYPE_RESOURCE_DUMP_PARMS)
sdbusplus has a utility method for this - please use.
Break out of the loop when this is found? Do you expect multiple resource dumps to be found?
As of now it expects one entry at a time. So I am adding break.

This is the file generated in requester. This is used to delete the file when hypervisor sends the File Ack command after validating the input parameters. We need to re-look when we support the multiple resource dumps. I shall add a comment here.
The InterfacesAdded signal gives you the property values. There's no need to make additional D-Bus calls.

Yes I am using the same dbus path passed from the InterfacesAdded signal. In the requester code I am using the "path" for error handling code also to update the status. Rather than passing through here I am moving this "path" variable to the constructor.

My comment is not about the path, it's about the dictionary of property:value. You get that with the signal as well, but you're not consuming it. You're making additional GetProperty calls, which is unnecessary and will impact performance (because there are D-Bus calls made).

I have changed the code not to use getDbusProperty() menthod. But when we receive the InterfacesAdded added signal, values of the properties are not populated and I get NULL values.
Also I had a tried to wait for different properties changed signals but facing issue with multiple properties changed signal and dynamic paths (entry/1, entry/2 etc) 
So I shall note this and may be later we can think of avoiding getDbusProperty() method. is that fine ?

This looks like a bug in the dump code or code that creates the resource dump d-bus object. I would expect the path to be something like /xyz/openbmc_project/dump/resource/<id>. It also seems like that code is emitting InterfacesAdded before populating the properties, which is another bug. Your call to getDbusProperty() may or may not work with this bug. I think that bug should be addressed and pldm code should watch for InterfacesAdded and consume properties like any other D-Bus client. Additionally, watch for PropertiesChanged if you care about that.
Okay once we get the data in the InterfacesAdded signal, probably additional check for PropertiesChanged signal may not be needed. Adding @dhruv to comment on this.
Need to check this, but I though interface added is coming on the root interface

signal time=4373675.071171 sender=:1.11 -> destination=(null destination) serial=59 path=/xyz/openbmc_project/logging; interface=org.freedesktop.DBus.ObjectManager; member=InterfacesAdded
   object path "/xyz/openbmc_project/logging/entry/2"

@Dhruv, there is the path that sends the signal, but also the path on which the interfaces are added (see above - I created an error log via the Logging.Create API).

Either @Jay did not paste the InterfacesAdded section correctly, or the object path itself is missing, which is odd. There should be an object path set to "/xyz/openbmc_project/dump/resource/<id>" and pldm code should be able to filter on that via the argN filter. That way the code here doesn't have to wake up for every dump type.
Need to test but there is another message which shows the path correctly, I think what Jay showing progress interface added

The dump code should be doing this - https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-logging/blob/master/elog_entry.hpp#L85. This is what I mentioned earlier - ensure to emit the signal after all properties are set.

In addition the PLDM code should use the arg0Path filter (see D-Bus spec/sdbusplus match API) to filter on the object_path being /xyz/openbmc_project/dump/resoruce/
I have changed the code as per review comments and re-tested good with Dhruv's patch.
This file got deleted when hypervisor sends the File Ack command after validating the input parameters.
You might be able to further filter this by looking at the specific resource dumps related path.

InterfacesAdded is coming with this path till dump. 
Sender=:1.305  Path=/xyz/openbmc_project/dump  Interface=org.freedesktop.DBus.ObjectManager  Member=InterfacesAdded

So changing to specific resource dump related path is working. But later if want to move properties change signal, then this needs a change.
So changing to specific resource dump related path is working --> So changing to specific resource dump related path is not working
Changed to specific resource dump path
